borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="text-align: left;"><span style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed side extension&nbsp;</span></span><span style="text-align: justify; font-size: 11pt;">would&nbsp;by reason of the scale, siting and design&nbsp;result in an increased sense of overbearingness and a harmful loss of outlook and daylight to neighbouring occupiers at No. 37&nbsp;</span><span style="text-align: justify; font-size: 14.6667px;">Langley</span><span style="text-align: justify; font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;Gardens, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:</span></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><o:p></o:p></p><ul><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Paragraph 125 of the National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, July 2021)</span><o:p></o:p></li><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy D6 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span><o:p></o:p></li><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</span><o:p></o:p></li><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies DMD1 and DMD 6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021); and</span></li><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</span></li></ul>

<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;">The proposed two storey side extension by reason of its sitting and&nbsp;</span><span style="text-align: start; font-size: 14px;">mass</span><span style="font-size: 14px;">&nbsp;</span><span style="text-align: start; font-size: 14px;">would appear as an&nbsp;</span><span style="text-align: start; font-size: 14px;">incongruous</span><span style="text-align: start; font-size: 14px;">&nbsp;addition to the host dwelling and the wider area. The extension would also extend the building line which will result in a loss of the&nbsp;</span><span style="text-align: start; font-size: 14px;">openness on the corner and disrupt the uniformity of the terrace. The gaps between dwellings such as this one, are a characteristic feature within the Becontree Estate which is a non-designated heritage asset protect for its&nbsp;</span><span style="text-align: start; font-size: 14px;">spaciousness, regularity of pattern of built form and homogeneity of design.</span><span style="font-size: 14px;">&nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</span></span></p><ul><li style="margin-top: 0cm; margin-right: 0cm; margin-bottom: 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;">Paragraphs 126, 130 and 134 of the National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, July 2021)</span></span></li><li style="margin-top: 0cm; margin-right: 0cm; margin-bottom: 7.5pt; text-align: start;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;">Policies D1, D4, and HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021)</span></span></li><li style="margin-top: 0cm; margin-right: 0cm; margin-bottom: 7.5pt; text-align: start;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;">Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</span></span></li><li style="margin-top: 0cm; margin-right: 0cm; margin-bottom: 7.5pt; text-align: start;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;">Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</span></span></li><li style="margin-top: 0cm; margin-right: 0cm; margin-bottom: 7.5pt; text-align: start;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;">Policies SP 2, DMD 1, DMD 4 and DMD 6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037 (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span><br></span></li><li style="margin-top: 0cm; margin-right: 0cm; margin-bottom: 7.5pt; text-align: start;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="line-height: 15.6933px;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;">Paragraphs 5.4.1 and 5.4.2 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</span></span></span></li></ul>
description: Construction of a single storey rear extension, a two storey side extension and relocation of the entrance to the front involving the construction of a front porch
